meanings.definition: A groove or recess cut into the edge of a piece of wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully measured the rabbet before cutting.
meanings.sent2: The bookshelf had a rabbet along its side for the back panel.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse found a cozy home in the rabbet of the wooden door.
meanings.sent4: The rabbet in the wall held secrets from a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The rabbet in the table was so smooth it felt like silk.

meanings.definition: To cut a groove or recess into the edge of a piece of wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will rabbet the wood to fit the glass perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She rabbeted the frame to create a seamless joint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to rabbet its initials into the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: He rabbeted the door to install a new lock.
meanings.sent5: The artist rabbeted the sculpture to add intricate details.
